message.content:
{"id": "2345", "title": "Bug 2345[Editor Mgmt] Open with a different type of editor has no effect if file already open (1GEWMSQ)", "description": "Bug 2345[Editor Mgmt] Open with a different type of editor has no effect if file already open (1GEWMSQ)", "OB": "Open a file with the Scripted Resource Editor example. Open the same file with the Default Text Editor. The file should be opened with the Default Text Editor.", "EB": "Reproduce the steps in 1GEWMOZ: ITPUI: WIN2000Scripted resource editor example opens on XML files by default:

1. Create a new basic project
2. Create a new file `test.xml`
3. In the Navigator, select `test.xml`
4. Choose 'Open With...' / `Default Text Editor`

Expected: The file should be opened with the Default Text Editor.

Actual: Nothing happens; it reactivates the Scripted Resource Editor example.

Searching for an existing open file should also consider editor types. When opening a file with a different editor type, a new editor should be opened on the file.", "SR": "Modify the code to correctly open a file with a different type of editor if the file is already open."}

origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '2345', 'title': 'Bug 2345[Editor Mgmt] Open with a different type of editor has no effect if file already open (1GEWMSQ)', 'description': 'Bug 2345[Editor Mgmt] Open with a different type of editor has no effect if file already open (1GEWMSQ) ', 'OB': '', 'EB': "Reproduce the steps in: 1GEWMOZ: ITPUI:WIN2000Scripted resource editor example opens on XML files by default new basic project new file test.xml the editor used is the scripted resource editor example, which totally ignores the XML file content select test.xml in Navigator choose Open With... / Default Text Editor nothing happens; it's reactivating the scripted resource editor exampleSearching for an existing open file should also consider editor types.It should open a new editor on the file, because the editor type is different.NOTES: ", 'SR': ''}
